definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This corporation is quite reliable, and never does business beyond its means.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司的比较可知，在经营上不做力所不及的事情。

sentences.english: Sorry, this is beyond my power.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，这是我力所不及的。

sentences.english: For average bread earners, it is beyond their means to afford houses and cars.
sentences.chinese: 对一般工薪阶层，购房买车是他们力所不及的。

sentences.english: It's beyond me to explain these.
sentences.chinese: 要解释这些我力所不及。

sentences.english: Such things are beyond my ability.
sentences.chinese: 那样的事是我力所不及的。

sentences.english: And if a couple fall out of love, drugs are unlikely to help either.
sentences.chinese: 要是一对匹俦不再相爱，药物多半力所不及。

sentences.english: I do think that it is beyond his power to fulfill the task.
sentences.chinese: 我的确认为完成这项任务是他力所不及的。

definition: beyond one's reach or power (to do sth)
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
not to be up to the task (idiom)/incompetent
to weigh one's abilities and act accordingly/to act according to one's means/to cut one's coat according to one's cloth
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: to assess one's capabilities and act accordingly (idiom); to act within one's competence/One does what one can.
